Opportunity [Description]: Join our WSIS+20 Working Group and help shape the future of our Internet vision and global policy. The WSIS+20 review is a key moment for digital development. Its outcomes will guide future UN action and stakeholder involvement.
Why It Matters: Ensure the Internet remains secure, open, and trustworthy.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Alumni

Outreach Activity [Title]: Community Dialogue: The Evolution of the Internet Governance Forum (IGF)
Opportunity [Description]: Hear from our community expert, Flávio Wagner from our Brazil Chapter, how the IGF has evolved over its 20 years of existence and join a lively discussion on which role the IGF should play in the future, and how.
Why It Matters: The global community is taking stock of two decades of progress toward achieving the WSIS vision and the IGF mandate is up for renewal.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Outreach Activity [Title]: WSIS+20 Five-Point Plan Follow-up: Eight Practical Recommendations
Opportunity [Description]: With Global Partners Digital (GPD) and a group of cross-stakeholders we have drafted Eight Practical Recommendations for the WSIS review with the aim of presenting tangible recommendations on how the WSIS co-facilitators can facilitate a transparent and inclusive process for the WSIS review.
Why It Matters: Ensuring transparency, inclusivity, and meaningful stakeholder engagement in the WSIS+20 review process.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members

Outreach Activity [Title]: Expert Group for a Technology Roadmap on Encryption [European Commission]
Opportunity [Description]: The European Commission is forming an informal Expert Group to “focus on current and future technical challenges impacting lawful access to digital information in the context of criminal investigations”. It is looking for technically skilled professionals with domain-specific expertise, especially in cybersecurity, telecom, big data analysis, digital forensics, fundamental rights, and data technologies.
Why It Matters: There are concerns about how the roadmap frames strong encryption as a barrier to the EU's internal security and describes “lawful access” as an uncontested goal.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Outreach Activity [Title]: Internet Society's New Advocacy Strategy – Session 1
Opportunity [Description]: Learn about our new Advocacy Strategy—a bold, collaborative effort to strengthen our ability to influence the decisions that shape the Internet’s future. Whether you're a long-time advocate or just getting started, your voice and actions matter. Join us to discover how you can play a key role in advancing our shared mission and defending what makes the Internet a force for good.
Why It Matters: As threats to an open, globally connected Internet grow, our collective voice and strategic action are more critical than ever.
Who Can Get Involved: Individual Members, Chapter Leaders, Organization Members, Alumni

Outreach Activity [Title]: Internet Society's New Advocacy Strategy – Session 2
Opportunity [Description]: Learn about our new Advocacy Strategy—a bold, collaborative effort to strengthen our ability to influence the decisions that shape the Internet’s future. Whether you're a long-time advocate or just getting started, your voice and actions matter.
